result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 09-09-2015 02:00 pm

Defendant Christel R. Jerome in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak.  Defendant Christel R. Jerome in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CT54 & 14CF55 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that there is a consolidation with Wood County and an amended information will be filed.  Atty Kryshak states that he has filed the consolidation paperwork with the court.
Court states that the consent forms were received by the Court from Wood County case #14CF242 for consolidation.
BY THE COURT:  Court accepts the consolidation and accepts the amended information.

  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Wood County case 14CF242 and Ct. 1 in 14CF55.  14CF54 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Kryshak agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
Atty Kryshak states that the parties are requesting a PSI.  Atty Hendee agrees.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Wood County case 14CF242 and Ct. 1 in 14CF55.  14CF54 to be dismissed and read-in.
PSI ordered.
Set for Sentencing.
bond continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing at 08-05-2015 02:00 pm

with conditions:
No contact with Corey Jerome except for in writing while in custody.

**Bond covers both 14CF54 & 14CF55

Defendant Christel R Jerome in court with attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow.  Defendant Christel R Jerome in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF54 & 14CF55:
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint's in both matters & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow requests a Preliminary Hearing.
Atty Hendee does not object to a signature bond with conditions:
No contact with Corey Jerome except for in writing while in custody.
Atty Zamzow has no objection.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
No contact with Corey Jerome except for in writing while in custody.
*Bond covers both 14CF54 & 14CF55

Atty Zamzow does not waive time limits.
BY THE COURT:  Set Prelim.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
